lead_paragraph: Each year, there are a handful of shootings that are not counted by the New York Police Department as crimes, although they may have led to fatalities.

headline.print_headline: Justifiable Homicides, Taken Off the Books, Alter a Murder Tally
headline.main: Justifiable Homicides, Taken Off the Books, Alter a Murder Tally

snippet: Each year, there are a handful of shootings that are not counted by the New York Police Department as crimes, although they may have led to fatalities.
abstract: New York Police Dept removes killing of Charles Williams in Queens from city's official tally of murder in 2015 after Queens prosecutors rule that shooting was justified; practice by which many police departments exclude justifiable homicides from their counts stands out more in New York since it could alter statistics on city's historically low murder rate.
